title: Meshulam's game
summary: In graph theory, Meshulam's game is a game used to explain a theorem of Roy Meshulam[1] related to the homological connectivity of the independence complex of a graph, which is the smallest index k such that all reduced homological groups up to and including k are trivial. The formulation of this theorem as a game is due to Aharoni, Berger and Ziv.[2][3]
